articles.content:
Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition held abroad
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition was held at the Auckland City Hall in New Zealand from June 8 to 13.   Displayed there were famous works of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books, photos and handicraft which show the advantage of the Korean-style socialism.
   At its opening ceremony the general secretary of the New Zealand Socialist Unity party said that the Korean people are now defending their cause united as one under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, though they are undergoing temporary difficulties caused by the blockade of the United States and by years of natural disasters.

articles.content:
Kim Il Chol meets Chinese delegation
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Vice marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Shenyang military area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by lt. General Ge Zhenfeng, deputy commander, who paid a courtesy call on him on June 20.
   KPA Lt. General Han Ung Man was present there.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK-Sudan relations
articles.content:
Indonesian guests arrive
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Feisal Tanjung, Coordinating Minister for Policy and Security of Indonesia, and his party arrived here on June 20 by plane.
   They were greeted at the airport by Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kim Il Chol, general of the Korean People's Army Jong Chang Ryol, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Tong Chun, and Indonesian ambassador to Korea Buchari Effendi and embassy officials.
   A welcome function was held at the airport.

articles.content:
Minister of People's Armed Forces meets Indonesian  delegation
    Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol, Minister of the People's Armed Forces, met and conversed with Feisal Tanjung, Indonesian Coordinating Minister for Policy and Security, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   Present there were general of the Korean People's Army Jong Chang Ryol and Buchari Effendi, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il from abroad
articles.content:
DPRK officials meet foreign delegations
   Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Pak song Chol, honorary vice-president of the presidium of the supreme people's assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with a delegation of the central committee of the fatherland front of Vietnam led by secretary general tarn van dang at the Mansudae assembly hall today.
   Present there were jo Kyu il, director of the secretariat of the central committee of the democratic front for the reunification of the fatherland, officials concerned and Vietnamese ambassador to Korea le Xuan Vinh.
Yang Hyong sop, vice-president of the presidium of the supreme people's assembly of the DPRK, conversed with a delegation of the Lao ministry of foreign affairs led by vice-minister Phongsavath Boupha on Monday.
   Present were vice-foreign minister of the DPRKPAk jong Chun and Lao ambassador to Korea Khamkheng Sayakeo.
   Foreign minister paek nam sun also met the delegation.

articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il from abroad
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from the visiting delegation of the Lao Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the central committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam.
   The gifts were handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, by Phongsavath Boupha, vice Foreign Minister of Laos who is leading the Lao foreign ministry delegation and to an official concerned by Tran Van Dang, secretary general of the central committee of the Fatherland Front of Vietnam who is leading its delegation.
